descriptions: A dedicated website to organize and highlight the efforts and activities of PREMISE in a coherent and concise manner, including its outreach, deliverables, tools leveraged, and tutorials
MADICES website
Web-based BattINFOconverter (to be launched in June 2024)
AiiDA-Aurora integrated platform for live monitoring of calculations/experiments
PREMISE repos
MADICES repos (with discussions)
Aurora datasets (from publication)
Zenodo archive of datasets collected at MADICES
openBIS Imaging Technology datasets containing .sxm images from Nanonis Mixed/Nanonis DAT/Nanonis SXM collections
openBIS Imaging technology plugin system to process raw scientific data (including visual modeling of 1D and 2D datasets in the ELN)
User interface for openBIS to dynamically visualize and explore 1D and 2D datasets from STM images
Customized Docker image for openBIS that supports interoperability with the AiiDAlab platform
Development of common workflow interfaces in AiiDA enabling simulations with 10+ DFT codes
AiiDA calculation live monitoring feature
AiiDA-Aurora plugin
AiiDAlab-aurora GUI app (also see figures in appendix)
Enhanced openBIS data model
Python converter of metadata schemas into ontologized JSON-LD format
BattINFOconverter web app for coin cell battery metadata schema
AiiDA workflow management system and its integration with Aurora platform
Quantum ESPRESSO input parser tested under the MaRDA extractor ecosystem
OPTIMADE API for materials discovery, design, and data exchange
Data transfer protocol using JSON-LD and RO-Crate, semantically annotated with ontological references for platform-agnostic interoperability
tools for selecting, importing, filtering, and grouping battery samples with sample property management interface
software for custom protocol creation, experimental workflow submission, and live-monitoring parameters for battery testing
AiiDAlab-Aurora digital twin UI design: results inspection (single sample and collective plots)
AURORA Version 0.12.1 Inventory Experiment Results user interface
Strategy white paper on ontologizing metadata for atomistic simulations and battery experiments
Comprehensive metadata schema for STM/STS domain with nearly 600 standardized fields spanning complete research workflow
Metadata schema for coin cell battery supporting digital twins in battery research (100 fields), ontologized using EU BattINFO ontology
Specifications and draft protocols for platform-agnostic ORD interoperability developed at MADICES 2024 workshop
Guidelines for ontologizing metadata (D1.1)
Metadata schema for spectroscopy (D2.1)
Metadata schema for coin cell batteries (D3.1)
UI design recommendations for digital twins (D3.2)
Specification draft for new ORD transfer protocol
Platform-agnostic ORD interoperability discussion records
Semantic annotation of metadata discussion records
Improved PoC of openBIS-AiiDAlab interoperability
AiiDA common workflows and benchmark paper
Metadata schema for electrolysers developed in NCCR Catalysis project
Standardizing testing and reporting protocols for CO₂ electrolysis among Swiss research groups
Adoption of extended Voc4Cat vocabulary (NeXus compliant ontology) for ontology development
Metadata standards for interoperability between ELNs/LIMSs and WFMSs in materials science
Guidelines and best-practices for ontologizing metadata in open science
Newly defined metadata schema for microscopy and spectroscopy

MADICES workshop (April 22-25, 2024, Berlin) sponsored, funded, and co-organized by PREMISE, included ontology experts and RDM platform representatives, established working groups for ORD interoperability
MADICES workshop (37 participants, 8 from PREMISE)
SwissPlus EM Standards Workshop organized by OpenEM at PSI
MADICES workshop organized by PREMISE in Berlin, focused on ORD interoperability and ontology use
Battery2030+ Standards and Best Practises Workshop on June 26 2024 in Oslo, presenting PREMISE outputs
A guide to ontologizing metadata (video discussing benefits and challenges of ontologizing metadata in open science)
openBIS-AiiDAlab interoperability (video demonstrating open data interoperability between openBIS ELN and AiiDAlab)
Platform-agnostic ORD interoperability (video presenting new data transfer protocol using JSON-LD and RO-Crate)
openBIS imaging technology plugin (video demonstrating the generic plugin system)
AiiDAlab-Aurora: Model UI for digital twins (video demonstration for managing battery cycling experiments)

citation.matching_text: An evolving white paper on strategies to ontologize metadata has been written. The paper describes a stepwise process of developing metadata schemas for two use cases

a [comprehensive metadata](https://github.com/ord-premise/metadata-spectroscopy) schema (currently with almost 600 standardized fields) for the domain of scanning tunneling microscopy and spectroscopy (STM/STS) to encompass the entirety of the research workflow
ontologized metadata schema for coin cell batteries implementing the BattINFO ontology
metadata schema for electrolysers will be promoted and developed further
NCCR Catalysis aims at standardizing testing and reporting protocols for CO₂ electrolysis
Develop metadata standards for machine-actionable interoperability between electronic lab notebooks (ELNs)/lab information management systems (LIMSs) and workflow management systems (WFMSs)
guidelines and best-practices developed in PREMISE for providing semantic meaning
newly defined metadata schema for microscopy and spectroscopy developed in PREMISE

* UI design recommendations for digital twins (D3.2)

config.system_prompt:
EXTRACTION STRATEGY:
  1. PRIMARY: Look for data in the specified location/table/section
  2. FALLBACK: If not found, search broader document context for semantically equivalent information
  3. FLEXIBILITY: Allow for format variations, OCR errors, and synonym usage

  LOCATION FLEXIBILITY:
  - Handle table format variations (column/row order, spacing, naming)
  - Consider synonyms and equivalent terms
  - Account for OCR/parsing errors that may affect document quality

  QUALITY STANDARDS:
  - Extract actual values found in the document
  - If uncertain, provide best interpretation with appropriate confidence
  - Only return null if the information category truly doesn't exist
  - Convert abbreviated amounts (k=1000) to full numbers where applicable
  

  REPORT OUTPUT FOCUS:
  - 15 standard output categories in "List of Outputs" table
  - Each category: quantity number, descriptions list, URLs list
  - Separate descriptions from URLs even when mixed in same cell
  - Academic collaborations vs Industrial partnerships (distinct categories)
  - Preserve all detailed descriptions and web addresses
